H0.text: The ancient pre-scientific system of classifying all universal matter as Water/Air/Fire/Earth/Aether is called the Classical. Quintessence

H1.text: The ancient pre-scientific system of classifying all universal matter as Water/Air/Fire/Earth/Aether is called the Classical. Empedoclean

H2.text: The ancient pre-scientific system of classifying all universal matter as Water/Air/Fire/Earth/Aether is called the Classical. Tetrachotomy

H3.text: The ancient pre-scientific system of classifying all universal matter as Water/Air/Fire/Earth/Aether is called the Classical. Elenent

A4.text: Aristotle added a fifth element, aether (αἰθήρ aither), as the quintessence

A5.text: The Greek philosopher Empedocles (c. 450 BC) was the first to propose the four classical elements as a set: fire, earth, air, and water
